com.zello.sdk

Class Zello

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zello.sdk.Zello

  • public class Zello
extends java.lang.Object

    The Zello singleton acts as the primary point of interacting to the Zello SDK.

    To get an instance of the object call getInstance(). Before using this class, call the configure(String, Context) method. For specific usage, see the sample projects.

    • Method Detail

      • beginMessage

        public void beginMessage()
        Starts sending a voice message to the currently selected user or channel.

        The method is asynchronous. When the message status changes, onMessageStateChanged() is called on the Events interface.

        See Also:
        endMessage(), selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme), Events.onMessageStateChanged()

      • cancelSignIn

        public void cancelSignIn()
        Cancels the currently running sign in process.

        This method won't have an effect if the user is already signed in.

        See Also:
        signIn(String, String, String, boolean)

      • configure

        public void configure(java.lang.String packageName,
                      Context context)
        Configures the Zello SDK.

        You must call configure(String, Context) or configure(String, Context, Events) before using any other SDK methods. In most cases, the Application.onCreate() method is the best place to do this.

        If the apk was downloaded from zellowork.com, packageName should be "net.loudtalks". If you are using a standalone version of the apk use "com.pttsdk".

        Parameters:
        packageName - The package name of the Zello for Work app.
        context - The context for the app.
        See Also:
        configure(String, Context, Events), unconfigure()

      • configure

        public void configure(java.lang.String packageName,
                      Context context,
                      Events event)
        Configures the Zello SDK and subscribes for Zello SDK Events.

        You must call configure(String, Context) or configure(String, Context, Events) before using any other SDK methods. In most cases, the Application.onCreate() method is the best place to do this.

        If the apk was downloaded from zellowork.com, packageName should be "net.loudtalks". If you are using a standalone version of the apk use "com.pttsdk".

        Parameters:
        packageName - The package name of the Zello for Work app.
        context - The context for the app.
        event - Events handler
        See Also:
        configure(String, Context), unconfigure()

      • connectChannel

        public void connectChannel(java.lang.String channel)
        Connects the user to a channel.

        The method is asynchronous. When the channel is connected, onContactsChanged() is called on the Events interface.

        Parameters:
        channel - The name of the channel to connect to.
        See Also:
        disconnectChannel(String), setAutoConnectChannels(boolean), Events.onContactsChanged()

      • disconnectChannel

        public void disconnectChannel(java.lang.String channel)
        Disconnects the user from a channel.

        The method is asynchronous. When the channel is disconnected, onContactsChanged() is called on the Events interface.

        Parameters:
        channel - The name of the channel to disconnect from.
        See Also:
        connectChannel(String), setAutoConnectChannels(boolean), Events.onContactsChanged()

      • endMessage

        public void endMessage()
        Stops sending a voice message.

        The method has no effect if there is no active outgoing message. The method is asynchronous. When the message status changes, onMessageStateChanged() is called on the Events interface.

        See Also:
        beginMessage(), Events.onMessageStateChanged()

      • enterPowerSavingMode

        public void enterPowerSavingMode()
        Limits communication between the Zello for Work app and the server to optimize power and data consumption.

        Call this method when Zello UI is not visible to minimize app power and data use. When in power saving mode the app won't receive non-essential status updates. Call leavePowerSavingMode to resume status updates when Zello UI is back on the screen.

        See Also:
        leavePowerSavingMode()

      • getAppState

        public void getAppState(AppState state)
        Gets info about the current application state.

        The method updates provided instance of AppState object with the current data. The object will not update automatically, so call this method every time you need to get the current info about Zello app and SDK state.

        Parameters:
        state - The object to copy data to.
        See Also:
        AppState, Events.onAppStateChanged()

      • getAudio

        public Audio getAudio()
        Gets an instance of the Audio class that is used to control Zello audio settings.
        Returns:
        The Audio
        See Also:
        Audio, Events.onAudioStateChanged()

      • getContacts

        public Contacts getContacts()
        Gets the list of users and channels in the contact list of the current user.

        The list includes users, channels and their statuses. The object returned will not update automatically, so use this method to get a fresh copy of the list when needed.

        When the list is updated in any way onContactsChanged() is called on the Events interface. Possible reasons for the contact list being updated include changes of online status of users, channels connecting and disconnecting, and modifications made to the contact list through web console or API.

        Returns:
        The contact list for the currently signed in user
        See Also:
        Events.onContactsChanged()

      • getInstance

        public static Zello getInstance()
        Gets the instance of Zello singleton object.
        Returns:
        Zello singleton instance.

      • getMessageIn

        public void getMessageIn(MessageIn message)
        Gets info about the current active incoming voice message.

        The method updates provided instance of MessageIn object with the current data. The object will not update automatically, so call this method every time you need to get the current info about an active incoming voice message.

        Parameters:
        message - The object to copy data to.
        See Also:
        MessageIn, Events.onMessageStateChanged()

      • getMessageOut

        public void getMessageOut(MessageOut message)

        The method updates provided instance of MessageOut object with the current data. The object will not update automatically, so call this method every time you need to get the current info about an active outgoing voice message.

        Parameters:
        message - The object to copy data to.
        See Also:
        MessageOut, Events.onMessageStateChanged()

      • getSelectedContact

        public void getSelectedContact(Contact contact)
        Gets info about currently selected contact.

        The method updates provided instance of Contact object with the current data. The object will not update automatically, so call this method every time you need to get the info about currently selected contact.

        Parameters:
        contact - The object to copy data to.
        See Also:
        Contact, setSelectedContact(Contact), Events.onSelectedContactChanged()

      • leavePowerSavingMode

        public void leavePowerSavingMode()
        Resumes full communication between Zello for Work app and the server.
        See Also:
        enterPowerSavingMode()

      • lock

        public void lock(java.lang.String applicationName,
                 java.lang.String packageName)
        Locks the default Zello for Work app UI to prevent users from accessing it.

        In this locked state, the Zello for Work app, when accessed by user, will only display an information screen with the name of your app that can be clicked to open the main activity. This does NOT interfere with the sending and receiving of messages through the SDK.

        This method is useful when you implement a fully custom UI in your app and want to prevent users from accidentally accessing the standard Zello UI.

        Parameters:
        applicationName - The name of your application.
        packageName - The package name of your application.
        See Also:
        unlock()

      • muteContact

        public void muteContact(Contact contact,
                        boolean mute)
        Mutes or unmutes a contact.
        Parameters:
        contact - The contact to mute or unmute.
        mute - Whether the contact should be muted or not.

      • openMainScreen

        public void openMainScreen()
        Opens the main screen of the standard Zello for Work app.

      • selectContact

        public void selectContact(java.lang.String title,
                          Tab[] tabs,
                          Tab activeTab,
                          Theme theme)
        Opens an activity, which lets the user select a user or channel to talk to.

        The Zello SDK provides a built-in UI for contact selection that is available when the user is signed in. You can customize the title of the activity (leave null for default), the tabs available, initial tab, and specify a dark or light theme.

        Use this method when you don't have an activity on the screen (i.e. from a service).

        Parameters:
        title - Activity title. Can be null
        tabs - Set of displayed tabs.
        activeTab - Initially active tab.
        theme - Visual theme for activity.
        See Also:
        selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme, Activity), setSelectedContact(Contact), getSelectedContact(Contact), Events.onSelectedContactChanged(), Events.onLastContactsTabChanged(Tab)

      • selectContact

        public void selectContact(java.lang.String title,
                          Tab[] tabs,
                          Tab activeTab,
                          Theme theme,
                          Activity activity)
        Opens an activity, which lets the user select a user or channel to talk to, from another activity.

        The Zello SDK provides a built-in UI for contact selection that is available when the user is signed in. You can customize the title of the activity (leave null for default), the tabs available, initial tab, and specify a dark or light theme.

        Use this method to open a contact selection UI from an existing activity.

        Parameters:
        title - Activity title. Can be null
        tabs - Set of displayed tabs.
        activeTab - Initially active tab.
        theme - Visual theme for activity.
        activity - Caller activity.
        See Also:
        selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme), setSelectedContact(Contact), getSelectedContact(Contact), Events.onSelectedContactChanged(), Events.onLastContactsTabChanged(Tab)

      • setAutoConnectChannels

        public void setAutoConnectChannels(boolean connect)
        Specifies whether newly added channels should connect automatically.

        Zello remembers whether the channel was connected by the user. The default behavior when user signs in for the first time or added to a new channel via web console or the API is to connect to that channel. Set connect to false to prevent this behavior. Call this method before signIn to make sure no channels are connected automatically on first sign in.

        The method doesn't affect the channels previously connected or disconnected by the user or the SDK.

        Parameters:
        connect - Enables autoconnect.
        See Also:
        connectChannel(String), disconnectChannel(String), AppState.isChannelAutoConnectEnabled()

      • setAutoRun

        public void setAutoRun(boolean enable)
        Specifies whether the Zello for Work app should be launched on the start of the OS.

        Configured autorun behavior persists between app launches.

        Parameters:
        enable - The boolean to enable this feature or not. By default, this value is true.
        See Also:
        getAppState(AppState), AppState.isAutoRunEnabled()

      • setExternalId

        public void setExternalId(java.lang.String id)
        Sets an optional external id tag used by Zello Server Recording.

        When set the provided id is included in the metadata of all messages sent by Zello, and could be accessed using Zello server API to query recordings metadata.

        The method has no effect unless the Zello Server Recording feature is turned on for the current network.

        .
        Parameters:
        id - Nullable; String indicating the external id.
        See Also:
        AppState.getExternalId()

      • setSelectedChannelOrGroup

        public void setSelectedChannelOrGroup(java.lang.String name)
        Selects a contact (channel or group) to send the messages to.

        Use a Contact object from the list returned by Zello.getContacts() method as an argument.

        Parameters:
        name - Nullable; The name of the channel or group to select. A null value will deselect the current contact.
        See Also:
        setSelectedContact(Contact), setSelectedUserOrGateway(String), selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme, Activity), Events.onSelectedContactChanged()

      • setSelectedContact

        public void setSelectedContact(Contact contact)
        Selects a contact (user or channel) to send the messages to.

        Use a Contact object from the list returned by Zello.getContacts() method as an argument.

        Parameters:
        contact - Nullable; a contact to select. A null value will deselect the current contact.
        See Also:
        getSelectedContact(Contact), setSelectedUserOrGateway(String), setSelectedChannelOrGroup(String), selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme, Activity), Events.onSelectedContactChanged()

      • setSelectedUserOrGateway

        public void setSelectedUserOrGateway(java.lang.String name)
        Selects a contact (user or gateway) to send the messages to.

        Use a Contact object from the list returned by Zello.getContacts() method as an argument.

        Parameters:
        name - Nullable; The name of the user or gateway to select. A null value will deselect the current contact.
        See Also:
        setSelectedContact(Contact), setSelectedChannelOrGroup(String), selectContact(String, Tab[], Tab, Theme, Activity), Events.onSelectedContactChanged()

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(Status status)
        Sets the current user's availability status.
        Parameters:
        status - The status to set.
        See Also:
        setStatusMessage(String), AppState.getStatus(), Events.onAppStateChanged()

      • setStatusMessage

        public void setStatusMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets the current user's custom status message text.
        Parameters:
        message - The custom message text to display in user's status.
        See Also:

      • signIn

        public boolean signIn(java.lang.String network,
                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password)
        Signs the user into the network with the passed in login credentials.

        See signIn(String, String, String, Boolean)

        Parameters:
        network - The network name or URL.
        username - The username to authenticate.
        password - The password for the username.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether a sign in was initiated or not.
        See Also:
        signIn(String, String, String, boolean), cancelSignIn(), signOut(), Events.onAppStateChanged()

      • signIn

        public boolean signIn(java.lang.String network,
                      java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password,
                      boolean perishable)
        Signs is the user into the network with the passed in login credentials.

        When connecting to an account hosted at zellowork.com, you can use the network name for network. When connecting to a standalone server, use the full server domain name or IP.

        The standard sign in behavior is to save logon credentials so that the next time the app is started it signs in automatically. Set perishable to true to sign in without saving logon credentials.

        The method is asynchronous. When sign in fails or succeeds, onAppStateChanged() is called on the Events interface. To cancel the sign in process, use cancelSignIn(). method.

        Parameters:
        network - The network name or URL.
        username - The username to authenticate.
        password - The password for the username.
        perishable - Whether or not the authentication information should be saved.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether a sign in was initiated or not.
        See Also:
        signIn(String, String, String), cancelSignIn(), signOut(), Events.onAppStateChanged()

      • signOut

        public void signOut()
        Signs out currently signed in user.

        The method does not remove saved user credentials.

        The method is asynchronous. When the sign out succeeds, onAppStateChanged() is called on the Events interface.

        See Also:
        signIn(String, String, String, boolean), Events.onAppStateChanged()

      • subscribeToEvents

        public void subscribeToEvents(Events event)
        Subscribes for Zello SDK Events.
        Parameters:
        event - Events handler.
        See Also:
        Events

      • unconfigure

        public void unconfigure()
        Disconnects the SDK from Zello for Work app and unsubscribes all Events handlers.
        See Also:

      • unlock

        See Also:

        Unsubscribes from Zello SDK Events.
        Parameters:
        event - Events handler.
        See Also:
        Events
